lore: In their societies, Imlers work as miners and diggers. Along with the Imlings, they establish their settlements in mountainous regions. The bonds between them are strong, forged from a very young age, and it is rare to see an Imler without an Imling partner.\n\nThe protuberances in the Silver Imler's shoulders sell at a high price in the black market. Their Imling partners try to convince them to remove them so that they are no longer a target for poachers.
menagerieDialog: (It unleashes a nasty burp into your face and laughs. Immature.)
(It slams its chest so hard you're surprised it didn't collapse its own lungs. It seems very angry.)
I love my Imling friends. I perfectly complement their brains with my brawn.\n\n(That's the most intelligent and self-aware thing you've ever heard an Imler say.)
(It's trying its damndest to swat at a fly in the air, to no avail.)
(This creature is trying to whistle unsuccessfully, perhaps trying to imitate someone it saw in the castle.)
name: Silver Imler
